ygData.subject: Re: When should I start smithing?
ygData.msgSnippet: Whoah buddy, slow down! Hehe, sorry I had to say it =) Anyways, based on my own personal experiences as a bard/smith... I found it MUCH easier to put 2 skill
ygData.messageBody:
Whoah buddy, slow down! Hehe, sorry I had to say it =) Anyways, based on my
own personal experiences as a bard/smith... I found it MUCH easier to put 2
skill points into smithing every level, no matter what your level... Believe
me, it will pay off in the long run... At level 3, if you can spare the
coin, I suggest starting to sharpen weapons... after that, you should (I
think) start making "metal bits", and then go onto bigger and better things
from there...

Good luck to ye friend!

--------------------------------
E'Ci (Reyan, Merreck, etc.)
crae@...

----- Original Message -----
From: Andrew Unangst <andrew_u@...>
To: <EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com>
Sent: May 3, 1999 8:04 AM
Subject: [EQ_SMITHS] When should I start smithing?


> From: "Andrew Unangst" <andrew_u@...>
>
> I'm a level 3 warrior/smith dwarf. I was wondering what time (level) I
> should putting points into blacksmithing? And how many points per level.
> Also, is it wise to be a tailor as well? I have many tailor friends were I
> can get leather armor, but I was wondering if it is worth the extra time
to
> make your own. I also have about 1pp in the bank, to buy materials with, I
> don't worry much about buying armor, (I get cloth for real cheap)
>
